problem.markdown:
1. The characteristics that conductors used for transmission and distribution should possess :
(x) High tensile strength and low sensitivity () All () Low specific gravity () Low cost
2. In AC system,
(x) All () There is a need to synchronize the alternators before they are put in parallel () As a result of skin effect, the resistance of the line is increased () In order to avoid corona loss and also to provide adequate amount of insulation in case of overhead lines, more spacing between the conductors is required
3. The transient voltage appearing across the contacts during arc period is called ________
() Arc voltage () Recovery voltage (x) Restriking voltage () All
4. A good porcelain insulator has compressive strength of about _________ and dielectric strength of _________ of its thickness.
() 7000 N/m2 , 6kV/cm () 70 N/m2 , 6kV/cm () 700 N/m2 , 6kV/cm (x) 7000 N/m2 , 60kV/cm
5. The function of __________ is to isolate the part of the power system in case of abnormal conditions.
() Isolator () Insulator (x) Circuit Breaker () All
problem.p: 1. The characteristics that conductors used for transmission and distribution should possess :

choicegroup.choice: High tensile strength and low sensitivity
There is a need to synchronize the alternators before they are put in parallel
As a result of skin effect, the resistance of the line is increased
In order to avoid corona loss and also to provide adequate amount of insulation in case of overhead lines, more spacing between the conductors is required

problem.p: 3. The transient voltage appearing across the contacts during arc period is called ________
4. A good porcelain insulator has compressive strength of about _________ and dielectric strength of _________ of its thickness.
5. The function of __________ is to isolate the part of the power system in case of abnormal conditions.
